intro: Tanaecium xanthophyllum, commonly known as the yellow bell tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, grayish bark and opposite, simple leaves. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
